Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
uwi.comp3607.jeopardy.game.GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
Coordinates the core Jeopardy gameplay for a single session.

The GameEngine enforces the rules of the game: it handles selecting questions, evaluating answers, updating scores, marking questions as used, advancing turns, and publishing gameplay events for logging.

This class does not perform any console I/O itself. User interaction is handled by higher-level code such as App.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEngine

      public GameEngine(GameState state, GameEventBus eventBus)
      Creates a new game engine wired to a game state and event bus.
      Parameters:
      state - the game state to mutate during play
      eventBus - the event bus used for process-mining style logging

  • Method Details

    • getState

      public GameState getState()
      Returns the game state controlled by this engine.
      Returns:
      the game state

    • getTurnHistory

      public List<Turn> getTurnHistory()
      Returns the ordered list of all turns that have been played so far.

      This history is used by the report generator to create the final turn-by-turn summary.

      Returns:
      immutable view of the turn history list

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Determines whether the game is over.

      The game ends when either:

      • All questions on the board have been answered, or
      • The game has been flagged to quit.
      Returns:
      true if no more turns should be played

    • quitGame

      public void quitGame()
      Signals that the game should be terminated.

      Sets the quit flag in the GameState and publishes an "Exit Game" event on the event bus.

    • selectQuestion

      public Question selectQuestion(Player player, String category, int value)
      Selects a question for the given player from the question board.

      If the category or value is invalid, or the question has already been used, this method returns null.

      Successful selections result in "Select Category" and "Select Question" events being published to the event bus.

      Parameters:
      player - the player whose turn it is
      category - the question category name
      value - the point value of the chosen question
      Returns:
      the selected Question, or null if not available

    • answerQuestion

      public Turn answerQuestion(Player player, Question q, String answer)
      Processes a player's answer to a question.

      This method:

      • Checks the answer against the question's correct option.
      • Adjusts the player's score (positive for correct, negative for incorrect).
      • Marks the question as used so it cannot be chosen again.
      • Records a Turn in the history list.
      • Publishes "Answer Question" and "Score Updated" events.
      • Advances to the next player's turn.
      Parameters:
      player - the player who answered
      q - the question that was answered
      answer - the answer given by the player (e.g., "A", "B", "C", or "D")
      Returns:
      a Turn describing the outcome of this interaction
